channel.title: Some Noob Iclarity tuts
channel.description:
Well i have looked through the forums and havent found many/maybe any tuts for Iclarity. So i have some i am going to share. I know they are noob but there isnt many out there. Comment if you find one i should add!
[SIZE="5"]How to add and delete global items.[/SIZE]
[SIZE="3"]To start off i will show you how to add an Global Object (Non Wall).[/SIZE]
Go to (May be different in your source) src\com\iClarity\player\ClientHandler.java.
Now when your in there your going to want to find the following things before editing things. -You global item id -Your X and Y coords where you want the object to be (usually a command ::mypos or ::coords) -And which direction you want it to face
Now while in clienthandler.java search for [CODE]public void callObjects() {[/CODE]
After you may have some lines that start with -createobject Or -replaceobject2
Before the } (Bracket) add the line [CODE]createobject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType);[/CODE]
now edit Int x= the X Coord Int y= the Y Coord Int type ID=The global object id Int orientation=which way its facing (0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH) Int tileObjectType= Will be 10 if adding an object not a wall.
after your done that you need to save compile and restart server and your object should be there.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[SIZE="3"]Now how to add a wall[/SIZE]
Go to (May be different in your source) src\com\iClarity\player\ClientHandler.java.
Now when your in there your going to want to find the following things before editing things. -You wall id -Your X and Y coords where you want the wall to be (usually a command ::mypos or ::coords) -And which direction you want it to face
Now while in clienthandler.java search for [CODE]public void callObjects() {[/CODE]
After you may have some lines that start with -createobject Or -replaceobject2
Before the } (Bracket) add the line [CODE]createobject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType);[/CODE]
now edit Int x= the X Coord Int y= the Y Coord Int type ID=The wall id Int orientation=which way its facing (0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH) Int tileObjectType= Will be 0 if adding a wall.
after your done that you need to save compile and restart server and your wall should be there.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[SIZE="3"]How to delete an Object.[/SIZE]
Go to (May be different in your source) src\com\iClarity\player\ClientHandler.java.
First find these following things -X and Y coords of the object
Now while in clienthandler.java search for [CODE]public void callObjects() {[/CODE]
After you may have some lines that start with -createobject Or -replaceobject2
Before the } (Bracket) add the line [CODE]ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 10);[/CODE]
now edit ObjectX=the X coords ObjectY=the Y coords
after your done that you need to save compile and restart server and your object should be gone.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[SIZE="3"]How to delete an Wall.[/SIZE]
Go to (May be different in your source) src\com\iClarity\player\ClientHandler.java.
First find these following things -X and Y coords of the wall
Now while in clienthandler.java search for [CODE]public void callObjects() {[/CODE]
After you may have some lines that start with -createobject Or -replaceobject2
Before the } (Bracket) add the line [CODE]ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 0);[/CODE]
now edit ObjectX=the X coords ObjectY=the Y coords
after your done that you need to save compile and restart server and your wall should be gone.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[SIZE="5"]Using and item on another item to get a different item.[/SIZE]
Purpose: Using an item on another item to create another item Example: Hilt on Blade for a GodSword.
Difficulty: -3
Tested On: iClarity.
Search Src/Com/iClarity/Player/PacketHandler/Packets/ItemOnItem
Look for; [CODE]if (itemUsed == 1733 || useWith == 1733) {[/CODE] Above that add; [CODE] if((itemUsed == **** && useWith == ****) || (itemUsed == **** && useWith == ****)) { p.deleteItem(itemUsed, p.GetItemSlot(itemUsed), 1); p.deleteItem(useWith, p.GetItemSlot(useWith), 1); p.sendMessage("Message Here."); p.addItem(****, 1); return; }[/CODE] For example, i made it so when i used a Divine Sigil on a spirit shield it would turn into a Divine Spirit Shield, so my code was.
[CODE]if((itemUsed == 5004 && useWith == 5016) || (itemUsed == 5016 && useWith == 5004)) { p.deleteItem(itemUsed, p.GetItemSlot(itemUsed), 1); p.deleteItem(useWith, p.GetItemSlot(useWith), 1); p.sendMessage("You have created a Spectral Spirit Shield."); p.addItem(5012, 1); return; }[/CODE] Save, Compile and your done.
All credit to G0nzo :P Took from Run3-S3rv3r
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Should i add pics? Post below -Best Regards Ashley1091000
P.S. Im Ashleyy from Run3-S3rv3r Ashley1091000 from Run3L0cus

item.title: Some Noob Iclarity tuts
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[/quote]

u grab some nuts and post some tuts then?[/quote]

You must be joking…

item.title: Some Noob Iclarity tuts
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Stop with these “noob” “beginner” tutorials, they aren’t tutorials, they are snippets to show you how to add objects and npcs.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Some Noob Iclarity tuts
item.dc:creator: @free99fish free99fish
item.description:
@free99fish wrote:

Well i have looked through the forums and havent found many/maybe any tuts for Iclarity. So i have some i am going to share.
I know they are noob but there isnt many out there. Comment if you find one i should add!

[SIZE=“5”]How to add and delete global items.[/SIZE]

[SIZE=“3”]To start off i will show you how to add an Global Object (Non Wall).[/SIZE]

Go to (May be different in your source) src\com\iClarity\player\ClientHandler.java.

Now when your in there your going to want to find the following things before editing things.
-You global item id
-Your X and Y coords where you want the object to be (usually a command ::mypos or ::coords)
-And which direction you want it to face

Now while in clienthandler.java search for

public void callObjects() {

After you may have some lines that start with
-createobject
Or
-replaceobject2

Before the } (Bracket) add the line

createobject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType);

now edit
Int x= the X Coord
Int y= the Y Coord
Int type ID=The global object id
Int orientation=which way its facing (0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH)
Int tileObjectType= Will be 10 if adding an object not a wall.

after your done that you need to save compile and restart server and your object should be there.

[SIZE=“3”]Now how to add a wall[/SIZE]

Go to (May be different in your source) src\com\iClarity\player\ClientHandler.java.

Now when your in there your going to want to find the following things before editing things.
-You wall id
-Your X and Y coords where you want the wall to be (usually a command ::mypos or ::coords)
-And which direction you want it to face

Now while in clienthandler.java search for

public void callObjects() {

After you may have some lines that start with
-createobject
Or
-replaceobject2

Before the } (Bracket) add the line

createobject(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType);

now edit
Int x= the X Coord
Int y= the Y Coord
Int type ID=The wall id
Int orientation=which way its facing (0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH)
Int tileObjectType= Will be 0 if adding a wall.

after your done that you need to save compile and restart server and your wall should be there.

[SIZE=“3”]How to delete an Object.[/SIZE]

Go to (May be different in your source) src\com\iClarity\player\ClientHandler.java.

First find these following things
-X and Y coords of the object

Now while in clienthandler.java search for

public void callObjects() {

After you may have some lines that start with
-createobject
Or
-replaceobject2

Before the } (Bracket) add the line

ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 10);

now edit
ObjectX=the X coords
ObjectY=the Y coords

after your done that you need to save compile and restart server and your object should be gone.

[SIZE=“3”]How to delete an Wall.[/SIZE]

Go to (May be different in your source) src\com\iClarity\player\ClientHandler.java.

First find these following things
-X and Y coords of the wall

Now while in clienthandler.java search for

public void callObjects() {

After you may have some lines that start with
-createobject
Or
-replaceobject2

Before the } (Bracket) add the line

ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, 6951, -1, 0);

now edit
ObjectX=the X coords
ObjectY=the Y coords

after your done that you need to save compile and restart server and your wall should be gone.

[SIZE=“5”]Using and item on another item to get a different item.[/SIZE]

Purpose: Using an item on another item to create another item
Example: Hilt on Blade for a GodSword.

Difficulty: -3

Tested On: iClarity.

Search Src/Com/iClarity/Player/PacketHandler/Packets/ItemOnItem

Look for;

if (itemUsed == 1733 || useWith == 1733) {

Above that add;

if((itemUsed == **** && useWith == ****) || (itemUsed == **** && useWith == ****)) { p.deleteItem(itemUsed, p.GetItemSlot(itemUsed), 1); p.deleteItem(useWith, p.GetItemSlot(useWith), 1); p.sendMessage("Message Here."); p.addItem(****, 1); return; }
For example, i made it so when i used a Divine Sigil on a spirit shield it would turn into a Divine Spirit Shield, so my code was.

            [CODE]if((itemUsed == 5004 && useWith == 5016) || (itemUsed == 5016 && useWith == 5004)) {
		p.deleteItem(itemUsed, p.GetItemSlot(itemUsed), 1);
		p.deleteItem(useWith, p.GetItemSlot(useWith), 1);
		p.sendMessage("You have created a Spectral Spirit Shield.");
		p.addItem(5012, 1);
		return;
	}[/CODE]

Save, Compile and your done.

All credit to G0nzo Took from Run3-S3rv3r

Should i add pics? Post below
-Best Regards
Ashley1091000

P.S. Im
Ashleyy from Run3-S3rv3r
Ashley1091000 from Run3L0cus

Read full topic
